quest.name: Primal Awakening
journal: Urianger would speak with you regarding the unidentified primal.

Cryptic as ever, Urianger informs you that the as-yet-unidentified primal may soon awaken. He then reveals that an equally unidentified individual who is known to the Scions has taken it upon herself to investigate the being, and would solicit your assistance. Make your way to Wineport in eastern La Noscea, where the mystery maiden awaits.

You arrive at Wineport to find Alphinaud's twin sister, Alisaie, who has been conspicuous by her absence throughout your struggles thus far. She reveals to you that Castrum Occidens straddles a cavern formed in the wake of the Calamity, and expresses her desire to probe its uncharted depths. Fight your way through the imperial stronghold and seek a path down into the darkness.
You have found the entrance to the cavern in the innermost sector of Castrum Occidens. Report your success to Storm Private J'brohka.

J'brohka reveals to you that she is in the service of Alisaie, although she has enlisted with the Maelstrom for reasons of convenience. Her affiliations thus declared, J'brohka urges you to spare neither preparation nor caution for your expedition. Alisaie believes the truth of the Calamity sleeps within the cavern's unknown depths...but will she find the answers she seeks?

※The Binding Coil of Bahamut can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
objectives: Report to the mystery individual at Wineport.
Fight your way through Castrum Occidens.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: When the senary moon did wane, there sounded a bloodcurdling roar. A new primal had roused, the portents gave us to believe, one whose identity yet lieth beyond our ken.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: By thy hand, three primals have since been vanquished. As each returned to the aether, 'twas observed that tremors foreshadowing this fourth grew in strength and frequency both.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The being doth quicken, and in time it shall become a scourge upon the land.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet even as we pondered a course of action, a benevolent soul did arise, one who would forestall this threat. Though she be tender in years, she is true of heart and steadfast of resolve.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: She would solicit thine aid, if thou art willing to proffer it. Lest thou wonder, this maiden is of our order. Thus did the Antecedent straightways consent that thou shouldst assist her howsoever thou mayest.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As soon as thou art able, hie thee to Wineport, where thy petitioner doth await thee even now. Thou shalt for a certainty find her visage strikingly familiar.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It has been a while, adventurer. As I recall, my brother Alphinaud took the liberty of introducing us when first─and last─we met.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But for the sake of propriety...Alisaie Leveilleur. I thank you for coming.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I have heard much and more of your exploits. By your hand, the Black Wolf is slain, and his Ultima Weapon destroyed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You are possessed of great strength and courage, that much is plain. I shall have need of one such as you if I am to see my mission through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As you may be aware, the violence of Dalamud's fall changed not only the face of the realm, but also the base of the realm. Specifically, it played havoc with the aetheric currents, creating vast confluences of aether below the surface. Among other phenomena, this led to the formation of subterranean caverns at key points of stress.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: One such cavern lies beneath Castrum Occidens, and extends to only the gods know where.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Despite appearances, Castrum Occidens is as much a research facility as it is a fortress. Gaius van Baelsar chose the site for no other reason than to probe the caverns without interference.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As you went about vanquishing the returned primals, I observed a repeating wave pattern in the aether, corresponding exactly to the dates on which you were reported to have felled Ifrit, Titan, and Garuda. Upon closer examination, it became clear that these unique waveforms emanated from deep beneath the aforementioned stronghold.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Crucially, I recorded the same pattern during the recent celebrations, and have since been given to understand that this phenomenon bears a disquieting similarity to one observed shortly prior to the Calamity.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Five years ago, my grandfather invoked the power of the Twelve that he might contain Bahamut.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alas, his efforts failed, and he vanished, together with his foe.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I would know the truth of what transpired that day─of Grandfather's fate, and of the metamorphosis that swept across the land.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In casting light upon these mysteries, we will find a way to cure what ails this world.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It is my belief that the answers I seek lie hid within the depths of the cavern. I would have you accompany me on an expedition to find them, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If truth be told, I am not wont to rely upon others, and have thus far handled matters alone. Yet I am not blind to my limitations. Unescorted, I cannot hope to succeed in this endeavor.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I swore that I would find a way to restore peace to Eorzea. If you desire the selfsame, then aid me, as you aided my brother and the Scions.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I am in your debt. You are a womanman of action, and I sense that we will accomplish much together.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But let us not waste any more time. As I mentioned, Castrum Occidens straddles the cavern I wish to explore. If I am to have a hope of reaching it alive, I will need you to infiltrate the stronghold first and locate a path into the depths.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, pray report your success to Storm Private J'brohka. You may consider her my assistant here in Wineport.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I have every faith that you will not fail me. Twelve speed your way, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As I mentioned, Castrum Occidens straddles the cavern I wish to explore. If I am to have a hope of reaching it alive, I will need you to infiltrate the stronghold first and locate a path into the depths.

dialogue.name: JBROHKA
dialogue.text: I've been expecting you, Forename. By your coming, I take it you have successfully located the cavern entrance inside Castrum Occidens?

dialogue.name: JBROHKA
dialogue.text: ...So that's where it's to be found! Marvelous! Oh, but allow me to properly introduce myself. J'brohka is my name, and it is my honor to serve Lady Alisaie. Though, for reasons of convenience, at present I also serve the Maelstrom.

dialogue.name: JBROHKA
dialogue.text: This uniform accords me certain privileges, you see─in particular, ready access to the Maelstrom's regional scouting reports. They provide a wealth of local knowledge, including information on secret passages.

dialogue.name: JBROHKA
dialogue.text: ...But enough about me. I shall notify Lady Alisaie of your discovery, that she may prepare for the expedition.

dialogue.name: JBROHKA
dialogue.text: Though I don't doubt your abilities, none can say what dangers lurk beneath Castrum Occidens. For my lady's sake as well as your own, please spare neither preparation nor caution. Pray choose your companions well.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to the Binding Coil of Bahamut. The subterranean labyrinth can be accessed by speaking with J'brohka.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Details such as the conditions of entry may also be had by speaking with the storm private.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The scars left by the Calamity...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can scarce breathe for the surfeit of aether...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Tell me, have you ever seen corrupted crystals such as these?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Such crystals manifested across the realm when the course of the great river of aether was irrevocably altered five years ago.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Behold one of the objects that caused that alteration: a fragment of the lesser moon, Dalamud.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ancient Allag created Dalamud─or Meteor, to use the Garlean name─to serve as a celestial prison for Bahamut.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Its fall inflicted grievous wounds upon the land─wounds that have yet to heal, as is evident from the corrupted crystals.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Amazing... Dalamud's internal defenses still function in spite of everything─a testament to the ingenuity of the Allagans.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The Garleans seek to appropriate their advanced technology, I am certain of it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We are about to come face-to-face with secrets that have long lain buried within the sands of time.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Great dangers may lie beyond, but we have come too far to turn back. The truth of the Calamity is within reach.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <gasp> Gods preserve...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Dark wings that would engulf the very heavens...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: These could only belong to Bahamut, the primal who laid Eorzea to waste five years ago.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: At Carteneau, my grandfather sought to imprison Bahamut anew by invoking the power of the Twelve.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alas, the dreadwyrm proved too powerful, and he soon broke free of his confines.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yet instead of resuming the destruction he had begun, Bahamut vanished. Whither to, no one knew...until this day.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I do not understand... If Bahamut is truly a primal, how is it that he retains his physical form?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Did Grandfather defeat him? Or is there some other explanation?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We must press on if we are to learn the truth.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is going rather more smoothly than I expected. It is indeed convenient to have a hero on hand.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gods... That the cavern should open up again, even at this depth...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hah! This resembles a finger...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <gasp> And so it should! This is Bahamut's hand!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As with the wings, it seems to be frozen, and for that I count my blessings. But again I find myself wondering, how is it able to retain physical form?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I had assumed that Bahamut's reversion to aether was the cause of the widespread changes to the realm. But if he is still here, then that theory no longer holds.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What was it, then, that brought about the realm's sudden regeneration? There is still so much we do not know about Carteneau...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I haven't the slightest inkling how deep these caverns run, but we must continue.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This contraption... Is it used to control the saturation of aether?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I suppose there is only one way to find out.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The dragon you vanquished earlier─doubtless you noticed the peculiar contraption about its neck.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It was likely a receptor of some description, used to enslave the creature.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ancient Allag possessed the means to control dragons, it would seem. The Ishgardians would kill for this knowledge, though to be sure, it could as easily be brought to bear against them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: An army of dragons could turn the tide of any battle, as the Garleans once learned to their sorrow. I would not be the least bit surprised if they now sought to exploit this power.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Whatever their plans, this serves as another reminder of the might of the Allagans. One cannot help but wonder how so advanced a civilization came to fall.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gods be good...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is...this is Bahamut's head!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And that enormous crystal─it pulsates as if...as if it were a heart! Then the primal that had awakened...was Bahamut all this time!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No! No, no, NO! This cannot be true! This...this would mean that Grandfather died for naught!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Confound it! We do not know enough to strike at it now! We must withdraw!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Who...? Who is that? No...it can't be...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Grandfather? Is it truly you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No... Don't leave me again... Please...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Grandfather!!!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I-I know... We can do no more for now...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hm? But this looks like...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: How did we come to be in northern Thanalan of all places?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, but such details matter little!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Grandfather's alive, Forename!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Bahamut did not defeat him!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But why won't he return to us? I don't understand...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This expedition has yielded more questions than it did answers.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: At any rate, we would both be better for a rest. Let us return to the Waking Sands and reflect upon what we have seen.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. Without you, none of this would have been possible.

obj.n: The Binding Coil of Bahamut - Turn 1
